page.title: 19Wolsingham Social Concerns
page.content: A major concern is the future of {Hollywood Hall,}a small hospital converted into a psychiatric home for the elderly.The number of wards has already been reduced and total closure would mean transferring patients to a psychiatric hospital over 20 miles away.This would involve job losses in an area with over{20% unemployment. Opposition to the closure has been led by local trade unions,the District Council and the local M.P.The closure of Hollywood would leave only one small hospital for the old in Weardale. There is also concern that Weardale might be used for{dumping nuclear {waste}in disused lead mines.Though there are no mines in Wolsingham, all waste would have to travel through the area.
